title: Shootings, grenade attack in Burundi
text:
Nairobi - At least seven people were killed in shootings and a grenade attack on Tuesday in Burundi's capital, police and residents said, in a further spate of violence following the election of President Pierre Nkurunziza to a third term.
Residents of the Ngagara neighbourhood - a stronghold for opposition supporters - said two police officers and a television cameraman and his family were among the dead.
Residents identified the cameraperson as Christophe Nkezabahizi who worked with state-run RTNB radio and television station, who they said was shot dead along with his wife and two children.
"Police found him [Christophe] with his whole family at home [and] killed him alongside other people who were fleeing shootings," said a neighbour and colleague who asked not to be named.
